posts.post_content:
How can you build a Sliver deck without four of these?
  
   
I'd like to see a throwdown between a bunch of Allies and a bunch of Slivers...in Emperor Format...
posts.html:
How can you build a Sliver deck without four of these?

I'd like to see a throwdown between a bunch of Allies and a bunch of Slivers...in Emperor Format...
Report Abuse  
Posted By: MrDoppleganger (4/20/2010 12:07:28 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
smiten, you can't ban a card - much less a entire, popular tribe - just because you keep getting beaten by them.  
  
Sliver decks are extra-weak to removal because of how they work. Just keep breaking them down before they have a chance to build up. Mass removal is also a must for those times when they outpace you (or get a [Crystalline Sliver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crystalline Sliver) out there).  
  
As long as you know you're facing a sliver deck it's easy enough to combat them. If you destroy aggressively and never let them establish a foothold (Which they do very very fast) then you can beat them.
posts.html:
smiten, you can't ban a card - much less a entire, popular tribe - just because you keep getting beaten by them.

Sliver decks are extra-weak to removal because of how they work. Just keep breaking them down before they have a chance to build up. Mass removal is also a must for those times when they outpace you (or get a Crystalline Sliver out there).

As long as you know you're facing a sliver deck it's easy enough to combat them. If you destroy aggressively and never let them establish a foothold (Which they do very very fast) then you can beat them.

Posted By: asskicker123456789 (7/24/2011 7:30:26 PM)

posts.post_content:
It's good but I never use one. I pretty much use R/G if I go slivers. You get enough buffs, unblockable-ness, double strike etc.. that you usually are pulling 20 damage too quick for opponents to react anyway. Without spamming removal or a mass removal device I think getting overly complex with slivers is a waste.   
  
Just ramp up and beat em to death. 3.5/5. I have no need for utility slivers.
